item.description:
SPARQL - Semantic Web Query Language Tutorial

presented by Lee Feigenbaum, Co-founder of Cambridge Semantics

 

SPARQL is the query language of the Semantic Web. This 90 minute talk will teach the SPARQL Query Language from the ground up, using real SPARQL queries that you can run on the Web today. We'll start from the most simple of SPARQL queries and build our way up to more complicated queries, demonstrating various features of SPARQL as we go. We'll also look at the new features of SPARQL 1.1 and discuss when they will be widely available.

Tutorial will be from 6-7:30pm - 90 minutes.
item.how_to_find_us: Rm 32-D463, 4th floor, Star Conference Room, Stata Center, MIT
item.name: SPARQL Tutorial -- Cambridge Semantic Web Monthly Meetup
